title: Tahsan Rahman Khan
text:
Tahsan Rahman Khan (born 18 October 1979) is a Bangladeshi <a href="actor">actor</a>, <a href="model%20%28person%29">model</a>, <a href="singer">singer</a>, <a href="songwriter">songwriter</a>,<a href="composer">composer</a> and <a href="teacher">teacher</a>. Born and raised in <a href="Dhaka">Dhaka</a>, Tahsan first started his music career at 21 through the music band <a href="Black%20%28Bangladeshi%20band%29">Black</a>. He later left the band and started his solo music career with the release of the album "Kothopokothon". He later started to act on television.
His works include studio albums, which are "Kothopokothon" (2004), "Krittodasher Nirban" (2005), "Icchche" (2006), "Nei" (2007), "Prottaborton" (2011), "Uddessho Nei" (2014), "Obhiman Amar" (2017). His work in films includes "Chuye Dile Mon" (2015), "Jodi Ekdin" (2019).
His song "Alo Alo" from the album "Icche" is one of the most popular songs in the country.
Early life and education.
He learned singing at <a href="Shishu%20Academy">Shishu Academy</a> and <a href="Chhayanaut">Chhayanaut</a>. He attended St. Joseph High School (Dhaka) and <a href="Notre%20Dame%20College%2C%20Dhaka">Notre Dame College, Dhaka</a>. He obtained a <a href="BBA">BBA</a> in marketing and an <a href="MBA">MBA</a> in finance from the <a href="Institute%20of%20Business%20Administration%2C%20University%20of%20Dhaka">Institute of Business Administration, University of Dhaka</a>. He completed a second MBA at the <a href="University%20of%20Minnesota">University of Minnesota</a> on a Fulbright scholarship.
Personal life.
Tahsan Khan met <a href="Rafiath%20Rashid%20Mithila">Rafiath Rashid Mithila</a> in 2004 when they were students at the <a href="University%20of%20Dhaka">University of Dhaka</a>. They married in 2006. The couple announced their divorce in 2017. Their daughter, Ayra Tehrim Khan, was four years old at the time.
Other works.
• <a href="Miss%20Universe%20Bangladesh">Miss Universe Bangladesh</a> 2020
